page.title: 05Get Your Skates On!
page.content: In my opinion, the best place for ice-skating is Oxford Ice Rink. There are two other local rinks near my home, Queensway in London and Richmond. When you watch ice-skating on television or at a rink, it looks terribly hard. You cannot believe that these people are moving around at such speed just on thin pieces of metal. Almost every time someone starts on ice they are guaranteed to fall over, either on their back or on their front. After a terrifying tour of the rink clinging to the side barriers with white knuckles, you find that you can stand up without holding onto the side; only to be knocked over by some flashy skater. After only a few trips, you will find that even you can withstand the 'speeders'. Don't forget to wear gloves, and be prepared for a wet and cold backside and aching feet.
